titleStmt.title: R. V. Wheeler to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4516

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your Petitioner R V Wheeler states that he has been fined $25-- in the Police Court in Danville for throwing water from his window he states that he was not apprised there was any Ordinance in said town making the same an offence, had he known of the existence of Ordinance he would not have done so, althogh he injured no person. He states he is poor and illy able to pay said fine. Wherefore he prays for a remission of the same by your Excellency & for relief
subscribed & sworn to before me by R V Wheeler This Jay 26 1864
M P. Chrisman C B C C
We Join in the prayer of the Petitioner

Geo. W. Webb
H. E. Samuel
William Goodloe
Almanzo Chiles
Wm M. Fields
M J Dishman
N S McGrorty
Saml. Messick
W. B. Edden
Wm M Stout
Names
W, W, Sanders
J. F. Gasner
J, P, Frorel
N T. Chrisman
N.
T. Mitchell
Names
